oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Algebraic geometry of Poisson regression
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kahle, Thomas
Oelbermann, Kai-Friederike
Schwabe, Rainer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Statistics Theory
Mathematics - Optimization and Control
Primary: 62K05 Secondary: 13P25, 14P10, 62J02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Designing experiments for generalized linear models is difficult because optimal designs depend on unknown parameters. Here we investigate local optimality. We propose to study for a given design its region of optimality in parameter space. Often these regions are semi-algebraic and feature interesting symmetries. We demonstrate this with the Rasch Poisson counts model. For any given interaction order between the explanatory variables we give a characterization of the regions of optimality of a special saturated design. This extends known results from the case of no interaction. We also give an algebraic and geometric perspective on optimality of experimental designs for the Rasch Poisson counts model using polyhedral and spectrahedral geometry.
